intro: Syzygium fergusonii, commonly known as the West Australian tallowwood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to southwestern Australia and is characterized by its smooth, dark grey to black bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by edible, red, fleshy berries. Syzygium fergusonii is often found in dry forests and woodlands, and it plays an important role in the local ecosystem by providing food for various wildlife species.
